title: 103_hr1292
content: The Act titled "Immigration Anti-Discrimination Improvement Act of 1993" is approved by Congress, based on findings from a GAO report on immigration reform and employer sanctions. Penalties for violating anti-discrimination provisions will be applied. The Immigration Anti-Discrimination Improvement Act of 1993 amends penalties for violating anti-discrimination provisions and allocates collected civil penalties for enforcement. Additionally, there is an increase in budget authorization for specific enforcement. The Immigration Anti-Discrimination Improvement Act of 1993 increases budget authorization for specific enforcement activities of regional offices of the Special Counsel for Immigration-Related Unfair Employment Practices within the Department of Justice by $10,000,000 annually starting from fiscal year 1994. Annual reports are also required. SEC. 4 of the Immigration Anti-Discrimination Improvement Act of 1993 mandates annual reports on unfair immigration-related employment practices and enforcement actions. The Comptroller General and Attorney General are required to submit reports to Congress each year. SEC. 5 amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow Federal and State agencies to receive charges related to unfair immigration-related employment practices and forward them to the Special Counsel. SEC. 6 establishes a national hotline. SEC. 6 amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to establish a national hotline for reporting unfair immigration-related employment practices. SEC. 7 provides technical assistance to States and local governments on immigration laws. SEC. 8 establishes a monitoring panel. SEC. 8 establishes a monitoring panel composed of various organizations to oversee anti-discrimination provisions in the Immigration and Nationality Act. The amendment to the Immigration and Nationality Act allows for disqualification from federal contracts for entities engaging in unfair immigration-related employment practices. This applies to practices occurring after the enactment of the Act.
